meanings.definition: A representation or image, especially sculpted, as on a monument.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed effigies of famous historical figures.
meanings.sent2: The artist created effigies of animals out of clay.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the effigies of the characters came to life and danced around the stage.
meanings.sent4: The effigies of the soldiers stood tall, symbolizing bravery and sacrifice.
meanings.sent5: The effigies of the gods in the temple were adorned with colorful decorations.

meanings.definition: A crude representation of someone disliked, used for purposes of ridicule.
meanings.sent1: The protestors burned effigies of the politician in the town square.
meanings.sent2: The effigies of the bullies were meant to mock their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The effigies of the mean teacher were so exaggerated that they made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Seeing the effigies of the bullies being torn apart was a cathartic experience for the students.
meanings.sent5: The effigies of the villains in the story were so lifelike that they gave everyone a fright.
